> [{quoted}](name=Torasuto,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RxAAi1aR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-28T18:17:29.251+0000)
> There's just a lot of Shaco hate since most people are fking stupid with him. They try to copy people like the Illuminati Shaco and end up feeding hard

This is actually the "Curse of Shaco."  It's been that way since always.  Shaco's decent skill curve with his reliance on map awareness, target selection, and surprise all add up splitting Shacos into one of two types of Shacos.

There are good Shacos that can pick of ADCs, counter jungle well, and otherwise play Shaco well.  Then, there are Shaco players who, while playing a game as Shaco, are also eating a sandwich, and therefore do poorly.

The problem is that if Shaco is eating a sandwich, he tends to feed.  So he falls into a feed of fed sort of niche, and nobody wants to gamble on that.

Shaco penalizes people who aren't playing safely, that's why people hate him so much.
Just about to barely finish your red buff at 200hp? Shiv throw and ignite with maybe a Q backstab thrown in for good measure.
Playing riven and barely won that trade with the enemy pantheon?  Shaco just backstab ignited you for firstblood and now you're behind.

Shaco is there when people dont want him there, he is what people fear COULD happen if they extend past the middle of the lane.
He is similar to evelynn, in that a good player can avoid all wards and be right on top of you before you know what happened.

All this being said, I love shaco, he is easily my favorite champ.  I own all of his skins (ty self-gift for workshop shaco) and would gladly play him anywhere, other* than adc.
